docs.title: EXO Developer Documentation Overhaul
docs.text: This documentation is a working plan and draft for improving the EXO project documentation, with a focus on developer onboarding, contributing, and clarity.

docs.title: Project Status
docs.text:
• The main README and public docs have not kept pace with the vibrant development and collaboration happening in the EXO community.
  • EXO is actively developed and supported by contributors from leading companies, with most real-time activity on Discord.
  • Requests for Work (RFW) are now the main way to get involved, replacing the old bounty system.

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text:
• EXO is a distributed AI inference framework that unifies heterogeneous devices (Mac, Linux, Raspberry Pi, etc.) into a single cluster.
  • Devices connect peer-to-peer (no master-worker), and models are partitioned across available memory.
  • The architecture supports multiple inference engines (MLX, tinygrad, etc.).
  • Device discovery is automatic, and the system is designed for minimal configuration.

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Q: Is EXO still active? A: Yes! While CI may be failing and the README is outdated, the project is active on Discord and in ongoing development.

Q: Where can I find Requests for Work (RFW)? A: See docs/todo/exo-needs.csv and GitHub issues for up-to-date RFWs.

Q: How do I get help or discuss ideas? A: Join the Discord for real-time support and collaboration.

Q: Are bounties still available? A: Most bounties are not currently active, but valuable contributions may be rewarded retrospectively.

Q: What platforms are supported? A: macOS, Linux, Raspberry Pi, and more. Devices with enough memory can join the cluster.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python >= 3.12.0
  • (Optional) NVIDIA drivers, CUDA, cuDNN for Linux GPU support

docs.title: (Optional) Use venv
docs.text:
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -e .

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: • See the README for platform-specific notes and troubleshooting tips.

docs.title: Quickstart Guide
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/nerdypaulbunyan/exo.git
cd exo
pip install -e .
exo
  • For multi-device clusters, repeat the above on each device.
  • exo will auto-discover other devices on the network.
  • Access the web UI at http://localhost:52415
